title: The Wrenchmen's Toolbox - Common Fixes to your League Issues
body:
**Wrenchmen's Toolbox**

Here's a list of common problems and questions as well as a few ideas/steps on how to solve these issues. Before you post a new thread, make sure to check this thread for a solution to your problem.

If you'd like to search directly for your issue, or want to see a complete list of common problems, make sure that you start with the League of Legends Knowledge Base - http://support.leagueoflegends.com/home .

If you don't see your issue, or the solutions here don't work, feel free to post in the forums for the helpful and well-tooled Wrenchmen, fellow players and occasional Riot Support Staff. Make sure to attach any relevant files to your post - http://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/20102273-attach-a-file-to-a-forum-post 

All issues are sorted in order of their possible occurrence from before you get in, to after you're done playing. The fixes aren't necessarily in the order that you should do them, but its strongly recommended that you do so. Please note, **whenever you test out a fix, you should always join a practice game, this lets you avoid being flagged by LeaverBuster if it doesn't work!**

Remember this is all to help you, help yourself. If you'd like additional support from Riot Staff, please open at ticket at https://support.leagueoflegends.com/tickets/new or post a thread in the Help and Support Community.

***Table of Contents:***

 * *Set-up and Install*
 * *Launcher Issues*
 * *Log-in and Account Issues*
 * *PvP.net/Client Issues*
 * *Store Issues*
 * *Matchmaking/Queue Issues*
 * *In-game Graphics Issues*
 * *FPS Issues*
 * *Lag and Disconnection Issues*
 * *Leagues Ranked System*
 * *Leavers and Bad Players*
 * *Post-Game Issues*
 * *End-User License Agreement and Terms of Use*


---***Getting Started - Setup and Install***---


**Where do I download this game?**

  1. http://signup.leagueoflegends.com/en/signup/redownload
  1. Please make sure you select the regional client you wish to use
  1. If the first link or Pando is giving you trouble, Use this link - http://na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=1474419

**What are the Minimum System Requirements?**

1. http://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/234272-system-requirements

**New Downloader Support**

1. http://www.pandonetworks.com/games/help

**I'm new, now what?**

1. You may want to visit the New Player Help Forums - http://www.leagueoflegends.com/board/forumdisplay.php?f=29

**I accidentally made my account on the wrong server!**

1. You can always make a new account under the same Username/Email information on the Server you wish to play on.  Just make sure that you select the correct region/server underneath where you input your Date-of-Birth!
2.  You can purchase a Account Transfer from the PvP.net Store under the "Other" tab.



---***Launcher Issues - You just clicked on the game icon, it's trying to patch...or not.***---



**Basic Launcher Troubleshooting**

1. Please start here with the Launcher Troubleshooting Guide - http://na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=1538750
2. If #1 and the info below don't fix your issue, Make sure you attach your logs (https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/22128450-League-of-Legends-Logs)

**Server Status: Unavailable/Busy**

1. The servers are actually down, check The Server Status Forum (http://leagueoflegends.com/board/forumdisplay.php?f=9), there's usually an announcement.
2. You need to Enable Scripting (http://support.microsoft.com/gp/howtoscript).
3. Restart your computer
4. If your Internet Explorer is in Offline Mode, change it.
5. You're set to use a proxy server, turn it off: Internet Options -> Connection -> Lan Settings -> Set to Auto Detect
6. Turn off Certificates in IE, IE Options > Advanced > Restore Advanced Settings, IE Options > Advanced > Uncheck "Check for server certificate authentication" (After successfully logging in, revert your certificate settings back to default to avoid any unnecessary security vulnerability)
7. Run through the other Windows & IE Troubleshooting in the KB (https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/21931765-Windows-Settings-Troubleshooting)
8. Try powercycling (restarting) your modem.
9. Reset your Internet Security Settings, Internet Options -> Advanced -> Reset Button
10. Make sure your computer's clock is synced (http://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/20201443-syncing-windows-clock)
11. Try this Fix from Microsoft - https://go.microsoft.com/?linkid=9657448
12. Uninstall Pando Media Booster

**Launcher Closes Without Warning / Does not open when clicked**

1. Try running as an admin by right clicking on the executable and selecting "Run As" and "Administrator"
2. Make sure your Internet Explorer Settings are set properly (https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/21931765-Windows-Settings-Troubleshooting)
3. If you recently did a system restore, had a virus or did a Windows reinstall, you may want to try reinstalling League of Legends (http://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/234176-reinstalling-league-of-legends).
4. Run through the RADS Fix in This Video - http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HHcfG9RV9Rw

**Error Message: "Unable to connect to the network"**

1. The game needs to be installed in a subdirectory (Such as, C://Riot Games) in order to work properly
2. You might have been logged in during downtime, try again in a bit

**I get a RADS error - Could not to connect to HTTP server / Patcher Kernel Stopped Working**

1. Close out your game/patcher, hit ctrl+alt+delete and make sure all instances of LoL.Launcher are gone, then restart the patcher process and let it sit.
2. Go to your Riot Games/RADS/System folder under your default install path, right click and run the rads_user_kernel.exe file as an admin, then try starting your patcher.
3. Try deleting your LoL_Air_Client folder (the default install path for this folder is c:\Riot Games\RADS\Projects) and then repatching.
4. See this article, About changing to a public DNS - http://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/234188-changing-to-public-dns-servers
5. Replace /RADS/system/rads_user_kernel.exe, with this file - http://l3cdn.riotgames.com/releases/live/system/rads_user_kernel.exe
6. Try installing, Microsoft Dot NET Framework 4.0 (http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=17851)and, Dot NET 3.5 (http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/e...displaylang=en] Dot NET 3.5)
7. Try running through the RADS solution in this Video Fix - http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=__DSdqE-Hao

**The Launcher stops downloading**

1. Let the Launcher run for up to 15 minutes
2. Restart the Launcher
3. Power Cycle (restart) your modem and/or router
4. Make sure that lol.launcher.exe is listed as an exception in your firewall
5. Turn off Peer 2 Peer transfer in your Patcher options
6. Temporarily disable firewall and anti-virus software.
7. Click on the two gears in the upper right of the patcher window and try the repair option.
8. Did you visit the Internet Connection Troubleshooting Article in the KB? - http://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/234285-internet-connection-troubleshooting
9. Try Reinstallingyour League of Legends - http://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/234176-reinstalling-league-of-legends

**The Launcher has experienced an error?**

1. Make sure you are current on your Windows Updates (http://update.microsoft.com)
2. Make sure you have Dot NET Framework 3.5 (http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyId=333325FD-AE52-4E35-B531-508D977D32A6&displaylang=en) or uninstall then reinstall your Dot NET Framework.
3. If you are running Windows Vista/Windows 7 make sure the install path is NOT in Program Files
4. Are you having A Connection Failure on logging in? - http://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/234161-connection-failure-error-when-logging-in
5. Reinstall League of Legends - http://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/234176-reinstalling-league-of-legends

**I get "the application has failed to start because the application configuration is incorrect"**

1. Make sure you're up to date on your Windows Updates (http://update.microsoft.com)
2. Make sure you have Dot NET Framework 3.5/4 (http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyId=333325FD-AE52-4E35-B531-508D977D32A6&displaylang=en)
3. Install, Microsoft C++ Redistributable - http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=8328 (Note: Link for x86 only, if you're running a 64 bit OS, find the correct version)
4. Reinstall your League of Legends, http://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/234176-reinstalling-league-of-legends

**I get, "Client Version 1.##.## is rejected by the server"**

1. Close any instances of PVP.net or the LoL launcher and restart your patcher. Allow it to complete.
2. After the patch process finishes, hit the button with 2 gears in the upper right corner of your patcher and complete the repair process.
3. If you are able to login, you may also want to try starting a custom game to see if you're still getting the version rejected error.
4. If that did not work, close your launcher and Delete lol_air_client and lol_launcher from (default path) C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects
5. Uninstall Pando Media Booster
6. Make sure you're up to date on your Windows Updates (http://windowsupdate.microsoft.com/)
7. Try running the game as an administrator, right click on the executable, select "Run As" "Administrator"

**The Patcher crashes my computer**

1. Reinstall your Video Card and Network Drivers
2. You may have bad memory/need to downclock your RAM 
  * *[For Windows Vista/7/8]*  In your Windows Search bar, type "memory" and select the Windows Memory Diagnostic.
  * Follow the prompts to restart your computer and scan your RAM.
3. You may have other bad hardware

**I can't click the Play button / nothing happens after I click the play button**

1. Check if your Active Scripting is disabled: Go to Internet Options -> Security -> Active scripting (near the bottom) -> Enable -> OK. Restart the launcher.
2. Go to your projects folder (Default path is C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects) and delete the lol_air_client, then restart your patcher.
3. Go to your projects folder and delete the lol_launcher folder inside, this will reset your patcher completely.
4. Try turning off your UAC in Windows 7/Vista (does not apply to XP) http://www.howtogeek.com/howto/windows-vista/disable-user-account-control-uac-the-easy-way-on-windows-vista/

**None of that worked, my internet is teh pwned**

1. Power Cycle (restart) your modem and router
2. Try plugging directly into your modem if you use a router
3. Reinstall your network card drivers
4. Reinstall League of Legends
5. Make sure Your Open Ports are Open (http://www.ismyportblocked.com/?pc=lol)
6. Make sure You forwarded the correct ports on your router (http://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/20133372-port-forwarding-for-league-of-legends)
7. If using a Bigfoot Killer NIC, set it to LLR App Mode
8. Run http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/, post in the Discussion Board with your results/issue
9. Check with your ISP about issues / blocking
10. If your Peer 2 Peer is blocked, try http://hotspotshield.com/
11. Try using this Stand-alone Client - http://na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=1474419



---***Cannot Login / Account Issues***---



**Connection Failure: Unable to connect to PVP.net**

1. Try syncing your Windows Clock, double check the time, date and year (http://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/20201443-syncing-windows-clock)
2. Make sure your Windows is up to date at http://update.microsoft.com/ 
3. Make sure you have opened your required network ports (https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/21948135-Port-Forwarding)
4. Make sure you’ve updated your Firewall (https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/21943565-Troubleshooting-the-Firewall) including this EXE (default install path), C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_air_client\releases\0.0. 0.68\deploy\LolClient.exe and this website, beta.lol.riotgames.com
5. Check out this article in the KB, on Connection Failures - http://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/234161-connection-failure-error-when-logging-in
6. Follow the other 11 network troubleshooting steps in the above section

**Invalid Username / Password**

1. Try again
2. Try again, again
3. Did you make a New Account yet? Link for US only - http://signup.leagueoflegends.com/
4. Try Recovering Your Account (http://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/234190-recovering-your-account)
5. Make sure you're on the correct Client (NA vs EU vs OC, etc, etc)
6. Servers may be down, try again later, (or Try again, and again, and again, but later)

**Some sort of Maestro Error**

1. Restart your computer
2. Temporarily Disable/Make exceptions in your Anti-virus/Anti-spyware software
3. Temporarily Disable/Make exceptions in your Firewall - https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/21943625-Adding-exceptions-to-the-Firewall
4. Disable process protection software.
5. Make sure you're running software in Administrative Mode/With admin privileges
6. In Windows Vista/Windows 7, double check your Account Controls
7. Reset your Internet Explorer Settings and make sure you have not disabled scripting options
8. Double check this article On Maestro Problems - https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/21692664-Maestro-General-Information

**Why was my name changed or How can I get my name changed?**

1. Your name was reported and Riot agreed it was offensive.
2.If Riot changed your name or you accidentally put your real name as your summoner name, please open at ticket (https://support.leagueoflegends.com/tickets/new) and they should be able to accommodate you. For other requests, please try creating a new account; Riot generally doesn’t grant other name change requests.
3. If you would like to change your name for any reason, name changes are available in the PVP.net store.

**Can I transfer characters/content**

1. Unfortunately, it is impossible to transfer any content between accounts or from different regions/servers under any circumstances. This includes, purchased unlocks, special skins, etc. Please be sure you upgrade accounts only when you are sure you wish to play on that server.

**I've accepted the Summoner's Code but my name is still grey.**

1. Take a look at this thread - http://www.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=592045

**How do I change the game default language?**

1. See the changing in-game language guide here - http://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/20159283-changing-game-language-after-installation

**I get a certificate error**

1. Your computer's clock my not be listing the correct date, make sure you sync your computer to the actual date (http://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/20201443-syncing-windows-clock )
2. Turn off Certificates in IE, IE Options > Advanced > Restore Advanced Settings, IE Options > Advanced > Uncheck "Check for server certificate authentication"
3. Make sure your Windows Settings are properly configured - https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/21931765-Windows-Settings-Troubleshooting
4. Update your Internet Explorer, or if you have a more updated version of Internet Explorer you may have to uncheck these settings instead: "Check for server certificate revocation," "Check for publisher's certificate revocation," "Warn about certificate address mismatch."

**Someone Hacked My Account! Help!**

1. Try using the automated account recovery system http://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/234190-recovering-your-account
2. Still having issues?  Open a ticket with Player Support at https://support.leagueoflegends.com/tickets/new 



---***PVP.net Issues / Can’t See Store, etc.***---



**Nothing shows up when I go into the store / I get a black screen**

1. Restart your client
2. Check to make sure you have cookies enabled in your Internet Settings.
3. You need to have TLS 1.0 & SSL 3.0 enabled, in Control Panel -> Internet Options -> Advanced tab, all the way at the bottom
4. Reset your Internet Explorer Settings (http://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/20205627-resetting-internet-explorer-settings-to-default )
5. Make sure you're not set to "Work Offline" mode in IE.
6. Update your Internet Explorer.

**The Lobby / Store does not display properly or at all**

1. Reset Internet Explorer to Default Settings - http://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/20205627-resetting-internet-explorer-settings-to-default 



---***Store Purchase Issues***---



**Says my store session has expired**

1. Check to make sure you have cookies enabled
2. Check out this article on Session Expired - https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/20207481-store-error-session-expired-there-was-a-problem-with-your-request

**I bought something from the store but it failed/gave an error/double charged**

1. Open at ticket with Riot Player Support with any issues related to real money (https://support.leagueoflegends.com/tickets/new). Make sure to include your name, your account name, when & what you bought and how you bought it.
2. If you tried to purchase with a credit card, See this article - http://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/20235628-credit-card-payment-errors.
3. Also, you may want to check out this http://www.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=191091&page=3

**I bought a champion and he/she/it is not showing up**

1. There is a visual bug where after you purchase a character they may still appear grayed out even if they are selectable. When you go into champion select, make sure to try clicking on the picture regardless.
2. Sometimes the system also takes a little while to update. Try logging out and coming back in to see if the champion becomes available.
3. Please check the PVP.net store FAQ on store issues - https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/23370583-PVP-net-Store-FAQ
4. If you've waited a while and for sure can't select the champion, please open at ticket at https://support.leagueoflegends.com/tickets/new

**My Prepaid Credit/Debit Card did not work for my purchase**

1. Visa/Mastercard require you to register your prepaid card before you can make online purchases. Registration should be available at your card provider's website.
2. Please see this Prepaid Card Thread for more information - http://www.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=415271

**I can't purchase anything with Paypal**

1. Hit the Tab button twice then hit your spacebar
2. Clear out your Internet Explorer Cache and Browsing History (https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/21947484-Clearing-Browser-History-and-Cookies)
3. Consult the Paypal Knowledge Base - https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/21723220-PayPal-Payment-Method

**I want to install a custom skin but am afraid**

1. Be afraid!  Modifying game files can cause your installation to become corrupted, requiring a re-install
2. If you still want to do it, please review this guide - http://www.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=80364

**I would like a refund** 

1. For information regarding the Refund feature, please consult the following Knowledge Base Article - https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/21158122-Content-Refund-Policy-
2. For additional information, please consult the Refund FAQ - https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/22026681-Content-Refund-FAQ
3. For all further inquiries regarding the Refund feature not already answered, please send a ticket to Player Support - https://support.leagueoflegends.com/tickets/new



---***Can't Enter A Match / Matchmaker Issues***---



**Before I enter a match, everything goes black/game doesn't start**

1. Your graphics card might not support Shader 2.0 - Meaning, you will need to get a new graphics card
2. Make sure your computer meets the Minimum Requirements (http://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/234272-system-requirements)
3. Make sure your display settings are set properly (http://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/234255-out-of-range-errors-black-screens-and-game-resolution)
4. If you can't get in, you can also change your resolution out of game (http://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/234255-out-of-range-errors-black-screens-and-game-resolution)
5. Check the Graphics troubleshooting guide - http://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/234286-graphics-troubleshooting

**After Champion Select, the game crashes**

1. Did you copy someone else's install? You will need to reinstall the game (http://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/234176-reinstalling-league-of-legends)
2. Double check your Firewall, Ports and Anti-Virus settings with the sections mentioned previously.
3. Use This link to update your DirectX install - http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?displaylang=en&FamilyID=2da43d38-db71-4c1b-bc6a-9b6652cd92a3 
4. Did you recently use System Restore? - You probably need to reinstall as this tends to corrupt League of Legends files (http://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/234176-reinstalling-league-of-legends)

**I get an "Out of Range Error" when starting a match**

1. Make even more sure your resolution is set properly (http://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/234255-out-of-range-errors-black-screens-and-game-resolution)

**I get a Shader Model 2.0 or Direct3D Error**

1. You do not have the correct graphics cards drivers installed, please reinstall or updated your drivers (https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/20116803-how-to-update-your-video-card-drivers)
2. You need to update your DirectX, http://support.microsoft.com/kb/179113

**Queue Is Taking Forever**

1. Let it sit for at least 5 minutes, more if you're in higher Tier
2. Try going out and coming back into Queue
3. Server may be doing an update or having issues, try playing a practice game. Title said game "Queue Hurts My Wookie"



---***In Game Graphics Issues and Errors***---



**Graphics Troubleshooting**

1. See the Graphics Troubleshooting Guide - http://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/234286-graphics-troubleshooting

**I got a BugSplat Error**

1. BugSplat is Riot's critical and compatibility error reporting tool. It's used to identify game conflicts with your specific system. Unfortunately, this means that these issues happen on a case-by-case basis and it's hard to offer a fix on the forums.
2. Some basic things to try include taking a look at this article in the KB (https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/22167690-Bug-Splat-and-Game-Crashes), updating your DirectX, Video Card Drivers, Microsoft Dot NET Frameworks, Windows Updates, Reinstalling LoL
3. As mentioned, because these issues are system specific they are difficult to address on the forums. If you need additional help please make sure you submit your BugSplat report, follow up with a ticket to Riot Support (https://support.leagueoflegends.com/tickets/new) and include your DxDiag report, your last few R3d Logs, and a Process List.

**I can't see the ground / I cannot see Champions / The fog of war covers everything**

1. Make sure that your Graphics Drivers are completely up to date - https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/20116803-how-to-update-your-video-card-drivers
2.  *For Mac users* - Make sure that you have no Razer programs (such as Razer Synapse) running in the background.  If you do, disable them.
3. *For Windows users* - Make sure that the Debug version of your DirectX is deactivated - https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/21734698-Disabling-the-Debug-Version-of-DirectX

**I'm a left hander / How do I use the keypad?**

1. You can add these to [GameEvents] (add it if it doesn't exist) to input.ini file (default location, C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\config)

evtScrollUp = [Num8]
evtScrollDown =[Num2]
evtScrollLeft = [Num4]
evtScrollRight = [Num6]

IMPORTANT: Make sure not to modify the input.ini file under defaults as that will break patching. Modify the one under League of Legends\RADS\solutions\lol_game_client_sln\release s\0.0.0.###\deploy\DATA\CFG and add one if it doesn't exist. You can use the one under defaults as a guide. 
2. If you wish, you can also consult the Knowledge Base article on how to complete this here - https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/20405097-Mouse-Keyboard-Issues



---***FPS Issues In Game***---



**I have bad FPS in game**

1. Read the FPS Guide in the Knowledge Base - https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/22000955-Advanced-Solutions-Improving-FPS-
2. Take a look at the FPS Troubleshooting Guide - http://na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?p=24115467

**The mouse pointer / menus are slow**

1. You have an integrated graphics card which doesn't run as well.
2. Turn off any running anti-virus scan or other program using lots of resources



---***Lag (Latency) and Disconnection Issues In Game***---



**I lag in game**

1. Turn off other downloading / streaming
2. Power Cycle (restart) your modem and router
3. Try plugging directly into your modem if you use a router.
4. Disable Peer-2-Peer transfers in the patcher (gears icon top right, save settings, restart PC)
5. Uninstall Pando Media Booster (Control Panel, Add/Remove Programs)
6. Reinstall your network card drivers.
7. Run http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/, post in the forums with your results/issue
8. Check with your ISP about issues / blocking
9. Try some Connection Troubleshooting Tips - http://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/234285-internet-connection-troubleshooting

**I always get disconnected in the middle of the game**

1. Try reconnecting! They still need you!!!
2. Check to see if you can still get online somewhere else.
3. Check your router settings or try plugging directly into your modem
4. If you are still experiencing issues, it may be the result of an unstable connection. Try the steps in this Knowledge Base Article -  https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/21696815

**I'm still connected, but I can no longer move or do anything**

1. Disconnect and reconnect to the game, you may have to shut down the client

**I got disconnected and have Game Still In Progress, but can't reconnect**

1. Wait 20-30 seconds and try again
2. If you keep crashing in the launcher, try downloading and unzipping this disconnection workaround tool, [http://www.wrenchbox.de/download/lol.reconnect.zip] then running the .exe file
3. The server may have crashed in which case everything’s going to be borked for a little bit. Come back in an hour and try again.

**I see myself stop moving, and then see people jump around/move really quick as if the game is catching up**

1.  This is typically a connectivity issue.  Make sure that you follow all of the steps in the following Knowledge Base Article - https://support.leagueoflegends.com/entries/21696815



---***Leagues Ranked System***---



**Why am I getting 1-5 LP for a win, but losing way more for a loss?**

1. This is known as clamping, and occurs when you're up for a Tier promotion but your MMR is far lower than expected. You can read a bit more about how and why this happens in the Season 3 FAQ - http://competitive.na.leagueoflegends.com/season-3-faq.

**I won a game but lost LP / I lost a game but still gained LP**

1. This is a visual display bug that can occur when the LP system is delayed. You did not actually lose LP for a game you won, it's just showing a previous update, and you will still get your points as normal.



---***Leaver Issues / Bad Players***---



**I have a leave, but it wasn't on purpose**

1. The leave system was always intended to flag disconnects for any reason. Even if you didn't rage quit, you still get a leave.
2. If you acquired a leaver mark due to circumstances beyond your control, (including disconnections, game crashes, etc.) unfortunately it is not possible to remove leaver marks from individual player accounts.

**I was banned what do I do?**

1. There are several types of bans ranging from temporary suspensions to permanent account bans, you should automatically receive an e-mail with ban information and terms if this occurs.
2. If you want to find out more or feel you have been unjustly banned, please open a ticket at https://support.leagueoflegends.com/tickets/new



---***Post Game Issues***---



**I didn't get any IP from the game I played**

1. Were you playing a practice (custom) game? After too many custom games in a short period will greatly reduce or eliminate IP or XP from those game types.
2. Open a ticket at https://support.leagueoflegends.com/tickets/new with your account name, when you played and what happened.

**My game crashes after I finish a match / It says I'm still in game**

1. Some 3rd party programs have been known to cause this, such as LOLrecorder.  Make sure that you try to disable these programs.
2. You may need more system resources (RAM). You should have at least 2 gigs
3. Avoid clicking the "skip waiting for stats" button, or give the server time to synchronize
